you
[Music]
hi and welcome you're listening to the
x-22 report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1332 a and today's date is July
14th 2017 and the title of the episode
is the central banker paper reveals the
process of controlling currency let's
get into the economic collapse financial
news now as we move further and further
into this summer it looks like the
people are starting to wise up and
they're starting to realize that there's
something not right in this economy and
right now what we're seeing is the
biggest 2-week plunge in Bloomberg's
index of the economic comfort in six
years and you Mitch is reporting one of
the biggest disappointments in the
preliminary print for June and they were
expecting a 95 and it came in at ninety
three point one this is the weakest
since October 2016 before the election
and now after the election when people
are saying that the economy is doing
well and everything's fine the Fed is
saying that looks great to me the
economy strong people are starting to
wise up and say you know everything
doesn't look as great as it really is
and we can see right now that hope well
it is declining rapidly and there's good
reason for all this because we've been
tracking it we understand that the
numbers that are coming in and if we
look past all the manipulation we see
what is really happening in the economy
now we know that the restaurant industry
they are not doing well and when we look
at chain restaurants they have slumped
to the worst they've ever been since
2009 now for six quarters in a row of
year-over-year declines it is just not
improving right now foot traffic at
chain restaurants fell 3 percent in June
same store sales fell 1% the 16th month
in a row of year-over-year declines
completing the sixth quarter in a row of
sales declines the longest like I said
since 2009 now food sales were also down
alcohol sales were down if you only
that was up our prices now remember the
Fed said there is no inflation so I
don't know how these prices are going up
but there's no inflation whatsoever I'm
seeing inflation all over the place yes
it's being stucked into many different
markets but we do see it now this is all
being reported by the executive director
of insights and knowledge for TV n2k
whose restaurant industry snapshot
tracks around 27,000 restaurant units
from a hundred and fifty five brands
generating about 67 billion in annual
revenue and what they saw was that sales
rose in 45 markets and fell in a hundred
and fifty now they report that the
summer season should be solid because
people have money to spend but what
they're seeing is that this is not
happening
there's been no major acceleration in
spending at restaurants and they
expected that it would be the same thing
with housing housing usually does very
very well in the summer and we're seeing
the opposite happen right now now if we
take this and we move it over to autos
automobile sales they are doing terribly
and there's one indicator that we can
look at here that shows us that auto
sales are not doing well because we know
that people don't go to the automobile
dealer and say hey listen here's 30,000
here's 20,000 here's 60,000 I want that
car what people do is they take out
leases most likely or they finance and
it looks like it's more more leases
because that's the cheaper price and
Wells Fargo is now reporting that loan
originations they have crashed by 45
percent year-on-year to only about 4.5
billion this is the lowest since the
banks started disclosing the item back
in 2013 so we're seeing a downtrend in
loan origination which shows you that
people are not buying cars
remember how it works the automobile
manufacturer produces as many cars as
possible and they stuff them into the
lot the more they stuff the more they
report those as sales it's not when the
individual buys them it's how much they
can stuff into the Lots and what's
happening right now since they sucked as
much as they possibly could they had a
lower the requirements for individuals
to buy those automobiles and now there's
no one left they've hit the subprime and
hid the subprime subprime people and
people just they're out of funds they
just can't do it and what we're seeing
is that delinquencies they are on the
rise and this is why it's pushing a lot
of individuals right out of the market
and automobile sales well they're going
to hurt as we move forward here it's not
going to get better we see core retail
sales
they are down negative two percent they
expected a positive two percent now this
is all of retail it's not like ooh let's
just look at brick-and-mortar let's just
look at online this is all of it now
remember how they calculate retail sales
even though we have stores closing and
let's say there's 50 stores that close
right now they don't say okay 50 stores
closed let's just cut that off
they have no sales no they take what
they have and they calculate it out for
the rest of the year so this way it's a
slow decline even though there's no
sales going on so it's a big trick to
make you think that things are a lot
better than they really are but when we
look at this we can see that again food
services down-
0.2% motor vehicle this is down at
negative point one percent we see
gasoline stations down negative one
point three percent clothing stores down
negative point one percent sporting
goods hobbies music stores down negative
point six percent we see general
merchandise department stores down
negative point seven percent
miscellaneous store retailers down three
negative three point one percent and
this goes on and on and on and we can
see that the retail market it's not
recovering it's only going to get worse
and to make matters even worse and to
understand how this economy is not
working at all
let's look at San Francisco for a second
here now people would think today that a
hundred and thirty-eight thousand
dollars a year would be a very nice
income you can live off that you can
maybe purchase a house you can raise a
family but in San Francisco there's a
new piece of legislation that was just
approved and what this allows it allows
couples earning up to a hundred and
thirty eight thousand to get subsidized
for affordable housing so if you're
making a hundred thousand ninety
thousand one hundred thirty thousand you
can get subsidized to purchase a house
this is how bad it is gotten who would
have ever thought making a hundred and
thirty thousand dollars you would be
going into affordable housing does that
make any sense whatsoever now you know
how the dollar has been devalued now you
see where inflation is going because
inflation really means that the value of
the dollar decreases it means you need
more dollars to get that same product
that same house and when it's not enough
the government has to step in to help
and we're getting to the point now where
a hundred and thirty thousand or even
one hundred thirty five thousand you can
get government assistance this should
tell everyone how bad it really is we
see that industrial production growth it
is slowed for the first time since
January now
month on month this is what the
corporate media is out there reporting
saying that oh we had this great rebound
it was up 2.3 percent this is fantastic
but you have to remember
they revised the numbers that revised
May they brought the numbers back into
June we made it look really great but
when you really look at it
year-over-year production has slowed it
is dropped it's falling it's declining
it's not doing what they say all they're
doing is manipulating the numbers and
revising it to make the next month look
even better and then they revise that
month to make the next one look better
and then when you go back in time you
look and you say wow this looks awful
and then when you go to last year well
how come it's getting worse if they're
telling you how it's getting better so
something is wrong here and you could
tell that things aren't going well
because JPMorgan they were giving a
presentation about their earnings and
they left out one important slide and I
think they did this on purpose and they
were out there saying that their
earnings and everything looks fantastic
the part that they left out was the
credit card charge offs because it shows
that JP Morgan's net credit card charge
off surpassed 1 billion dollars as of
June 30th and it's the highest point
going back to 2013 now as a reminder
remember what Jamie Dimon said that the
US consumer remained healthy remember
whenever a politician a banker a central
banker comes out there and tells you
something it's always the opposite when
they tell you in the bank listen don't
worry everything's under control it's
all contained you will be able to get
your funds so you don't have to worry
that's the point where you run to the
bank and you get as much as you possibly
can actually probably at that point it's
too late so what we're looking at here
is that their credit card losses they
were at 1.4 billion an increase of a
hundred and ninety three million and
this tells you that something is wrong
here now this
it's with the bigger picture where the
credit card default it is surged to the
most since the financial crisis because
when we look at the credit card default
this is SP Experian default index we see
that it is risen by three point five
three percent up more than 13 percent a
year ago so all of this jives together
and it all makes sense so is the US
consumer really that healthy if retail
sales are continually declining foot
traffic spending in restaurants is
continually declining loan originations
in the automobile industry is declining
really the US consumer is really healthy
when charge-offs are up by a hundred and
ninety three million and that's just one
bank now think about this now what is
happening here is that the economy is
limping along it's actually dead it's on
the ground here the central bankers the
banks they're all trying to keep it
they're trying to keep it going as long
as they possibly can because they want
to control the narrative they want to
make sure they have full control of how
this comes down they know it's dead the
problem is the rest of the nation
doesn't know there's a few select we
know but there's many others that are
completely in the dark people are just
living in this world that they where
they think that everything is absolutely
fantastic and what's worrying is they're
going to be shocked when the system
comes down I mean there were plenty of
people that were shocked when everything
crashed in 2008 when people lost their
investments their pensions and
everything else this time around it's
going to be a disaster now there was a
paper that was out there this was during
the Jackson Hole and they were talking
about negative interest rates and there
was a paper that was written and
basically it talks about how to abolish
the paper currency
and you would think that they would be
like okay you know what we're going to
do we're going to say it's because of
you know drug trafficking we're going to
and this is what they've been using but
when you look at the paper and you see
an excerpt of this and how to kill cash
because this was what the talk was about
it wasn't about negative interest rates
it was about how to control the currency
and how to control the people who are
using the currency and here are some
parts of what they were talking about
the most straightforward way to
unencumbered interest rate policy
completely at the zero bound is to
abolish paper currency now they thought
of different ways to do this now of
course they're saying that you know it's
being used for drug trafficking for
laundering money and this is why we have
to remove it and they tried to use this
in other countries around the world and
it has worked but the other way is to
get people very comfortable in using
mobile devices get people very
comfortable in using their credit card
or debit card and the other way is to
raise the ATM charges so people don't go
and use the ATM machines because they
say if they can continually raise these
charges people will take out less and
less cash because they don't want to be
charged for it so they were thinking
listen if we put a charge on the
withdrawal of cash even if it's your
bank people would stop taking out cash
and it would look natural like oh this
is just part of the thing they increase
my fees now I'm being charged for cash I
might as well use my credit card my
debit my mobile phone and they wanted to
get people used to this and then all of
a sudden start taking away some of the
bills get rid of the hundred get rid of
this and eventually what would happen is
you would be left with no cash
whatsoever and everything would be
electronic now they're doing this
because they understand when this system
comes down and going forward they want
complete control of the currency and how
else do you have complete
the currency well it's when you control
the currency electronically and I'm not
talking about the blockchain even if I
am talking about the blockchain I'm
talking about the controlled blockchain
by the central bank because they are
looking at this but when they control it
this is not a decentralized blockchain
system so they're looking to control
everyone and what this enables them to
do well they can just shut things down
whenever they want now they can still
shut it down but you still have the
ability to have cash see this is the
difference you can go to one of these
places you can take a check and they
will give you cash well think about it
when cash is gone it goes into an
electronic account and then they have
full control they also have the ability
to know exactly what you're doing they
know exactly where all your funds are so
there's no way of getting out of paying
any type of taxes or trying to do
anything to show that you didn't make
any money to pay taxes they want full
control to make sure they know exactly
what you're doing and they had a meeting
about this they're pushing this forward
and they already had test cases around
the world and this is all being prepped
for when the system comes down and the
whole reset is done and we can see once
the reset is done we might not even see
paper currency anymore because if the
central bank has their way everything
will be digital they will have full
control and this is exactly what they
want but we as a people we have to push
our government we have to push to say
listen we don't need the central bank we
don't need what they are pushing on us
we don't want it and at this point when
the system comes down this is what we're
going to have to do
listen everyone thanks a lot for
listening be well be safe and especially
be prepared thanks a lot
[Music]
you
